app_window = pyautogui.getWindowsWithTitle('Warframe')[0]
# Get the coordinates of the application window
left, top, right, bottom = app_window.left, app_window.top, app_window.right, app_window.bottom
# Capture the screenshot
screenshot = ImageGrab.grab(bbox=(left, top, right, bottom))
new_width = screenshot.width // 2
new_height = screenshot.height // 2
resized_screenshot = screenshot.resize((new_width, new_height))

label: server_address
peekOfCode:
server_address = ('192.168.32.156', 12345)  # Replace with the server's address and port
client_socket.connect(server_address)
while True:
    # Get user input
    message = input("Enter a message to send to the server (or type 'exit' to quit): ")
    if message == 'exit':
        break  # Exit the loop if the user types 'exit'
    # Send the message to the server
    client_socket.send(message.encode('utf-8'))
# Close the socket

label: server_socket
peekOfCode:
server_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
# Bind the socket to a specific address and port
host = '192.168.32.156'  # Loopback address for localhost
port = 12345  # You can use any available port
server_socket.bind((host, port))
# Listen for incoming connections
server_socket.listen(5)
print(f"Server listening on {host}:{port}")
# Accept a connection from a client
client_socket, client_address = server_socket.accept()
